citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), EROS Data Center
citeinfo.title: New York City Area Digital Elevation Model, 1/3 Arc Second (meters), 1999

descript.abstract: New York City Area Digital Elevation Mode, 1/3 Arc Second (meters) is a raster dataset representing elevations in the New York City area. This layer was clipped from the USGS NED to New York City and its immediate surrounding environment reprojected to show elevation and ground units in meters. The resolution is 1/3 arc second.
descript.purpose: Geospatial elevation data are utilized by the scientific and resource management communities for global change research, hydrologic modeling, resource monitoring, mapping, and visualization applications.
descript.supplinf: The U.S. Geological Survey has developed a National Elevation Dataset (NED). The NED is a seamless mosaic of best-available elevation data. The 7.5-minute elevation data for the conterminous United States are the primary initial source data. In addition to the availability of complete 7.5-minute data, efficient processing methods were developed to filter production artifacts in the existing data, convert to the NAD83 datum, edge-match, and fill slivers of missing data at quadrangle seams. One of the effects of the NED processing steps is a much-improved base of elevation data for calculating slope and hydrologic derivatives. The specifications for the NED 1 arc second and 1/3 arc second data are: Geographic coordinate system Horizontal datum of NAD83, except for AK which is NAD27 Vertical datum of NAVD88, except for AK which is NAVD29 Z units of meters

cntaddr.address: U.S. Geological Survey EROS Data Center

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical accuracy is basically +/- 7 to 15 meters. It alls depends on the original source DEM and if it was level 1, level 2, or 10m resolution.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), EROS Data Center
citeinfo.title: National Elevation Database

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were conducted by Digital Social Science Center (DSSC) staff: This layer was clipped from the USGS National Elevation Dataset to New York City and its immediate surrounding area.
